RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
Engenheiro Mecвnico (FEI, 1995), Mestre e Doutor (ITA, 1999 e 2007) em Eng. Aeronбutica e Mecвnica (бrea de concentraзгo Aerodinвmica, Propulsгo e Energia), Pуs-Doutorado em Eng. Tйrmica e de Fluidos (UNICAMP, 2016). Licenciatura plena em Matemбtica e Fнsica (UCB, 2007).
Em empresas e indъstrias, atuaзгo profissional como Engenheiro de Desenvolvimento do Produto (EMBRAER, >11 anos), Eng. de Seguranзa do Trabalho (UNITAU, 2001) em atividades de perнcia e avaliaзгo judicial, e no Georreferenciamento de Imуveis Rurais (FEAP, 2006). 
No ramo acadкmico, й orientador/pesquisador de Mestrado/Eng. Mecвnica (UEM/PEM, desde 2017), e atua no cargo de Prof. Associado (D-3) na UFGD - Universidade Federal da Grande Dourados (FAEN - Faculdade de Engenharia), nos cursos de Engenharia Mecвnica (coordenador/fundador 2014-15) e Engenharia de Energia (coordenador/fundador 2009-10), e em disciplinas/cursos EaD (UFGD & IFMS).
Atividades de P,D&I, experiкncia na Coordenaзгo de projetos de pesquisa aprovados em уrgгos de fomento federal e estadual, elaboraзгo de propostas para projetos de Engenharia (indъstrias e empresas), lнder do grupo de pesquisa ARENA/CNPq (credenciado ANP em 2013).
Junto а entidades cientнficas e acadкmicas: Membro Sкnior da ABCM (desde 1997), Membro do Comitк ABCM/Energia e Sistemas Tйrmicos (2013-2017) e do Comitк Cientнfico RNC - Rede Nacional de Combustгo (2013-2017); Consultor Ad-hoc de IES e FAPs (FUNDECT, FAPDF, FAPES, FAPEMIG, etc); Integra banco de avaliadores INEP/MEC (BASIs / SINAES), ENADE /BNI e ARCUSUL /BIPE+RANA. 
Revisor de periуdicos cientнficos (Energy, IJHMT & Experimental Thermal and Fluid Science / Elsevier; JBSMSE & Energy Efficiency / Springer, dentre outros).
Tem experiкncia e atua na бrea de Engenharia Mecвnica, com кnfase em Energia, Engenharia Tйrmica e de Fluidos (Mecвnica dos Fluidos, Transferкncia de Calor e Termodinвmica); Mбquinas, Motores e Equipamentos; Engenharia experimental, Energias renovбveis e biomassa.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN:
Mechanical Enginneer (FEI, 1995), Doctorґs and Masterґs degree in Aeronautical and Mechanical Sciences (ITA, 2007) and Post-doctoral in Thermal and Fluid Science (UNICAMP, 2016). Degree in Mathemathics and Physics (UCB, 2007).
Associate professor at UFGD, at Mechanical and Energy Engineering undergraduation courses. Has experience in Mechanical Engineering, focusing on Fluid Mechanics, Heat Transfer and Thermodynamics.
In industry and companies, I work as a Product Development Engineer (EMBRAER, >11 years), Work Safety Engineering (UNITAU, 2001) in forensic activities and judicial technical reports, and in Rural Properties Georeferencing (FEAP, 2006). 
In the academic field, is a mentor/researcher of Master degree in Mechanical Engineering (UEM/PEM, since 2017), and serves as Associate Professor (D-3) at UFGD - Grande Dourados Federal University (FAEN - Collegety of Engineering), in undergraduation courses as Mechanical engineering (coordinator/founder 2014-15) and Energy Engineering (coordinator/founder 2009-10), and in disciplines/courses EaD (UFGD & IFMS).
R,D&Inovation activities experience in the Coordination of research projects approved in federal and state funding agencies, Engineering projects proposals preparation (industries and companies), leader of the research group ARENA / CNPq (ANP accredited in 2013).
Together with scientific and academic entities: ABCM Senior Member (since 1997), Member of the ABCM/Energy and Thermal Systems Committee (2013-2017) and the RNC Scientific Committee - National Combustion Network (2013-2017); Ad-hoc consultant of Educational Institutions and FAPs (FUNDECT, FAPDF, FAPES, FAPEMIG, etc.); It integrates inep/MEC evaluator bank (BASIs / SINAES), ENADE /BNI and ARCUSUL /BIPE+RANA. 
Reviewer of scientific journals (Energy, IJHMT & Experimental Thermal and Fluid Science / Elsevier; JBSMSE & Energy Efficiency / Springer, among others).
He has experience and works in the area of Mechanical Engineering, with emphasis on Energy, Thermal and Fluid Engineering (Fluid Mechanics, Heat Transfer and Thermodynamics); Machines, Engines and Equipments; Experimental engineering, Renewable energy and biomass.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Eficiкncia energйtica em mбquinas e equipamentos rurais (CNPq N° 050/2008 - CT-Energ)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Edital MCT/CNPq/CT-Energ nє 50/2008 - Valor Aprovado (CNPq): R$ 174.838,44
Ampliaзгo da capacidade laboratorial em tecnologia de uso racional de energia dentro do contexto da Lei de Eficiкncia Energйtica.
Linha de Pesquisa 2: Capacitaзгo de laboratуrios de eficiкncia energйtica para suporte ao Programa Brasileiro de Etiquetagem ? PBE.
Resumo: Existe uma ampla variedade de mбquinas e equipamentos rurais que sгo consumidoras de energia e, no Brasil, a atividade ligada ao campo ? agronegуcios ? tem sido responsбvel por uma parcela representativa da geraзгo de renda, empregos e do PIB ? Produto Interno Bruto. Diante deste quadro e da necessidade de ampliar a capacidade laboratorial em tecnologias de uso racional de energia dentro do contexto da Lei de Eficiкncia Energйtica (Lei 10.295/2001) que busca implantar uma polнtica nacional de conservaзгo e uso racional de energia com fins а preservaзгo do meio ambiente, aplicaзгo eficiente dos recursos energйticos com base em viabilidade tйcnica e econфmica, este projeto de pesquisa intitulado ?Eficiкncia Energйtica em Mбquinas e Equipamentos Rurais? estб sendo apresentado. O projeto propхe-se a apresentar critйrios para mensurar com indicadores tйcnicos pertinentes os nнveis mбximos de consumo especнfico de energia (ou mнnimos de eficiкncia energйtica) para mбquinas e aparelhos utilizados nas atividades relacionadas ao agronegуcio que se desenvolvem no campo e nas indъstrias localizadas na regiгo Centro-Oeste, iniciando-se com aquelas da regiгo sul do Estado de Mato Grosso do Sul, mais especificamente em seu pуlo regional de desenvolvimento conhecido como Grande Dourados (abrange 12 municнpios), onde a instituiзгo executora UFGD se faz presente.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
Call MCT/CNPq/CT-Energ 50/2008-amount approved (CNPq): R$ 174,838.44
Expansion of the laboratory capacity in rational use of energy technology within the context of the energy efficiency Act.
Research line 2: energy efficiency Laboratory Capacity to support the Brazilian labeling Program ? PBE.
Summary: there is a wide variety of machines and equipment that are energy-consuming rural and, in Brazil, the activity connected to the field ? agribusiness ? has been responsible for a representative portion of the generation of income, jobs and GDP ? gross domestic Product. On this framework and the need to expand the laboratory capacity in rational use of energy technologies within the context of the energy efficiency Act (Law 10,295/2001) that seeks to implement a national policy for the conservation and rational use of energy for the preservation of the environment, efficient application of energy resources on the basis of technical and economic feasibility , this research project entitled "energy efficiency in Rural machinery and equipment" is being presented. The project seeks to introduce criteria to measure with relevant technical indicators the maximum levels of specific energy consumption (energy efficiency or minimum) for machinery used in activities related to agribusiness that develop on the field and in the industries located in the Midwest, beginning with those of the southern state of Mato Grosso do Sul, more specifically in its regional development pole known as Grande Dourados (covers 12 municipalities) , where the executing institution UFGD is present.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Avaliaзгo do potencial regional para aproveitamento de energia solar e eуlica na regiгo da grande Dourados (FUNDECT N° 09/2008 - Universal)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Pretende-se utilizar dados disponibilizados livremente por 2 (duas) estaзхes meteorolуgicas disponнveis na regiгo da grande Dourados. Uma delas й localizada no campus da cidade universitбria da UFGD ? Universidade Federal da Grande Dourados (http://www.ufgd.edu.br/clima) e possui dados de interesse (radiaзгo solar e velocidade do vento coletada a 2 metros de altura) armazenados coletados desde 03/10/2002, alйm de outros dados usuais (temperaturas, umidade relativa e precipitaзгo), sendo que a mesma estб localizada na latitude 22˚ 11', longitude 54˚ 55' e altitude de 452 m.
O objetivo geral й qualificar os dados de interesse, ou seja, validar os valores quantitativos dos mesmos e realizar correзхes (ajustes numйricos) de maneira que apуs o tratamento destes dados, os mesmos possam ser utilizados para estimar o potencial disponнvel de energia solar e eуlica nos pontos de coleta. Esta base de dados posteriormente poderб ser expandidos para outros locais da regiгo.
Valor Aprovado (FUNDECT): R$ 4.675,50
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
We intend to use data made available freely for 2 (two) weather stations available in the region of grande Dourados. One of them is located on the campus of the University City of UFGD-Universidade Federal da Grande Dourados (http://www.ufgd.edu.br/clima) and has data of interest (solar radiation and wind speed collected the 2 meters high) stored collected from 10/3/2002, plus other usual data (temperature, relative humidity and precipitation), and the same is located at latitude 22° 11 ' , longitude 54° 55 ' and altitude of 452 m.
The general objective is to qualify the data of interest, i.e. validate quantitative values and perform corrections (numeric settings) so that after treatment of this data, they can be used to estimate the available potential of solar and wind energy collection points. This database may subsequently be expanded to other locations in the region.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Estudo da influкncia das mudanзas climбticas no mecanismo de desenvolvimento limpo de microalgas para a biofixaзгo de CO2 produzido durante a combustгo do carvгo (CNPq N° 05/2010 - FNDCT)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Edital MCT/CNPq FNDCT Nє 05/2010 - Valor Aprovado: 286.207,58 R$
Capacitaзгo Laboratorial e Formaзгo de RH em Fontes Renovбveis
Linha de Pesquisa 5: Mudanзas Climбticas, Climatologia e Meteorologia. 
A elevaзгo da concentraзгo de CO2 na atmosfera terrestre й considerada uma das principais causas do aquecimento global. Dentre as tйcnicas que tкm sido propostas para promover o seqьestro de CO2, a fixaзгo biolуgica atravйs do cultivo de microalgas й apontada como uma alternativa promissora, jб que paralelamente ao
seqьestro de carbono ocorre a formaзгo de biomassa rica em compostos de valor comercial. Em face disto, o presente projeto tem por objetivos selecionar espйcies com potencial para a biofixaзгo (captura) de diуxido de carbono. Serгo bioprospectadas de diferentes ambientes aquбticos (lagoas de бgua doce e salgada e бguas residuбrias) espйcies de microalgas com potencial biotecnolуgico para a biofixaзгo de diуxido de carbono. Serгo avaliados ainda a produtividade de biomassa, a concentraзгo celular mбxima, a taxa mбxima de seqьestro de CO2 e a composiзгo da biomassa obtida.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Motores de Combustгo Interna 2 Tempos: eficiкncia e curvas caracterнsticas operando com diferentes misturas combustнveis (FUNDECT N° 10/2011 - Universal)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Esta proposta de projeto de pesquisa foi concebida a partir da identificaзгo do uso crescente de motores de combustгo dois tempos, de pequeno porque, em modelos de mбquinas diversas atualmente no mercado. O uso destes equipamentos na forma de sopradores de ar, roзadeiras/cortadores de grama, moto-serras, podadeiras, dentre outras ferramentas muitifuncionais portбteis (ex: cultivadora, derriзadora, lavadoras de alta pressгo, cortador a disco, etc), tem sido intensificado em atividades diversas, tais como: residencial (limpeza de jardins, quintais e terrenos), grandes бreas pъblicas (limpeza de jardins, ruas, estacionamentos, etc), manutenзгo de estбdios e rodovias, бreas industriais, бreas rurais, florestais e tambйm limpeza de mбquinas e equipamentos agrнcolas (colheitadeiras, tratores e outros). O interesse й desenvolver pesquisa aplicada, que possa resultar em potencial inovaзгo tecnolуgica, ao utilizar uma fonte de energia renovбvel, como й o caso do combustнvel lнquido Etanol, em misturas com gasolina em proporзхes diferentes daquelas estabelecidas pela ANP (atualmente 20%). Para isso, й necessбrio projetar e construir bancadas experimentais capazes de realizar ensaios diversos para levantamento do desempenho e curvas caracterнsticas dos motores de combustгo interna dois tempos, alimentados com misturas combustнveis diferentes das proporзхes comerciais (desde 0% atй 100% de etanol). Os ensaios deverгo obter, via instrumentaзгo adequada (bancada dinamomйtrica e sistema de aquisiзгo de dados) os parвmetros de desempenho (torque, potкncia mecвnica e consumo especнfico; composiзгo dos gases de combustгo e as curvas caracterнsticas resultantes em funзгo da rotaзгo (rpm).
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The proposed research project was conceived from the identification of the increasing use of two-stroke combustion engines, small because, in several machines models currently on the market. The use of this equipment in the form of air blowers, trimmers/lawn mowers, chainsaws, trimmers, among other muitifuncionais tools (e.g. very, derriзadora, high pressure washers, disc cutter, etc), has been intensified in various activities, such as: Residential (cleaning of gardens, backyards and plots), large public areas (cleaning of gardens, streets, parking lots, etc.), maintenance of stadiums and highways , industrial areas, rural areas, and also clearing of agricultural machines and equipment (combines, tractors and other). The interest is to develop applied research, which can result in potential technological innovation, by using a renewable energy source, as is the case with liquid fuel ethanol, in mixtures with gasoline in proportions different from those established by ANP (currently 20%). For this, it is necessary to design and build experimental benches capable of performing several tests for performance survey and characteristic curves of the two-stroke internal combustion engines, fuel mixtures other than those fed commercial proportions (from 0% to 100% ethanol). The tests should obtain, via appropriate Instrumentation (English bench and data acquisition system) the parameters of performance (torque, power, and specific consumption; composition of exhaust gases and the resulting characteristic curves as a function of rotation (rpm).

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Climatizadores e Ventiladores: capacitaзгo e ensaios para determinaзгo da eficiкncia energйtica (FUNDECT N° 11/2014 - Universal)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O problema principal abordado nesta proposta envolve a realizaзгo de atividades de P,D&I em climatizadores evaporativos e ventiladores industriais, com a capacitaзгo de RH e laboratуrios da UFGD/FAEN ? Faculdade de Engenharia (cursos de Eng. de Energia e Eng. Mecвnica). Mais especificamente, trata-se do desenvolvimento tecnolуgico experimental de engenharia, com realizaзгo de ensaios e medidas (instrumentaзгo e sistema de aquisiзгo de dados) das grandezas envolvidas nas etapas de conversгo da energia em mбquinas e equipamentos. Tambйm se prevк o desenvolvimento de metodologia que possa ser aplicada а climatizadores evaporativos e ventiladores industriais, para os quais ainda nгo existe roteiro de certificaзгo desenvolvido pelo INMETRO, existem apenas para ventiladores residenciais (mesa e teto). O objetivo principal й investigar as curvas caracterнsticas de funcionamento de climatizadores e ventiladores (pequeno e mйdio porte) por meio de ensaios e mediзхes de grandezas de interesse, considerando os modelos comerciais disponнveis pelos principais fabricantes nacionais. O tema do projeto proposto estб inserido no вmbito do desenvolvimento cientнfico, tecnolуgico e industrial do paнs. Situa-se no вmbito de algumas diretrizes temбticas dos fundos setoriais CT-Energ e outros.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The main problem addressed in this proposal involves the realization of r, D&I in air conditioners evaporative and industrial fans, with the qualification of HR and UFGD Labs/FAEN-College of Engineering (Energy Engineering and Mechanical Engineering). More specifically, it is the technological development of experimental engineering, with testing and measurements (instrumentation and data acquisition system) of the variables involved in the steps of energy conversion in machines and equipment. Also foresees the development of methodology that can be applied to evaporative coolers and industrial fans, for which there is still no script developed by INMETRO certification, there are only for residential fans (table and ceiling). The main objective is to investigate the operating characteristic curves of air conditioners and fans (small and medium businesses) by means of tests and measurements of quantities of interest, considering the available business models by major domestic manufacturers. The topic of the proposed project is located within the scientific, technological and industrial development of the country. Is located within some guidelines of sectoral funds thematic CT-Energ and other.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Motores de combustгo 2T (Ciclo Otto): Caracterнsticas de operaзгo com (bio)combustнveis nгo convencionais (CNPq N° 14/2013 - Universal)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Esta proposta de projeto de pesquisa foi concebida a partir da identificaзгo da significativa 
disponibilidade de gбs natural e biogбs no estado de Mato Grosso do Sul e o potencial uso destes (bio)combustнvels em motores de combustгo interna de pequeno e mйdio porte, os quais sгo amplamente utilizado em diversas atividades no meio rural na regiгo Centro-Oeste e Norte do Brasil.
O interesse й desenvolver pesquisa aplicada na forma de desenvolvimento tecnolуgico experimental, quepossa resultar em potencial inovaзгo tecnolуgica, ao utilizar uma fonte de energia renovбvel, como й o caso do biogбs (atй 100% metano), tambйm em misturas com o gбs natural em diferentes proporзхes (0 a 100%) e dos gases nгo-condensбveis obtidos em processos de gaseificaзгo (carbonizaзгo e/ou torrefaзгo de biomassa para produзгo de carvгo vegetal). Para isso, й necessбrio projetar e construir bancadas experimentais capazes de realizar ensaios diversos para levantamento do desempenho e curvas caracterнsticas dos motores de combustгo interna (2T). Os ensaios deverгo obter, utilizando metodologia estabelecida em normas ABNT e instrumentaзгo adequada (bancada experimental e sistema de aquisiзгo de dados), os parвmetros de desempenho(curvas caracterнsticas de consumo especнfico, torque, potкncia e eficiкncia em funзгo da rotaзгo) e caracterнsticas qualitativas e quantitativas das emissхes dos gases produzidos na combustгo (O2, CO, CO2, NOx, material particulado e hidrocarbonetos, dentre outros). Outros parвmetros de interesse tambйm serгo avaliados, tais como temperaturas e pressхes adequadas para combustгo eficiente.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
The proposed research project was conceived from the identification of the significant availability of natural gas and biogas in the State of Mato Grosso do Sul and the potential use of these (bio) combustivels in internal combustion engines of small and medium businesses, which are widely used in various activities in rural areas in the Midwest and northern Brazil.
The interest is to develop applied research in the form of technological development, can result in potential technological innovation, by using a renewable energy source, as in the case of biogas (up to 100% methane), also in mixtures with natural gas in different proportions (0 to 100%) and Non-Condensable gases obtained in gasification processes (charring and/or roasting of biomass for the production of charcoal). For this, it is necessary to design and build experimental benches capable of performing several tests for performance survey and characteristic curves of internal combustion engines (2T). The tests should obtain, using established methodology in ABNT and appropriate Instrumentation (experimental Workbench and data acquisition system), performance parameters (specific consumption characteristic curves, torque, power and efficiency as a function of rotation) and qualitative and quantitative characteristics of emissions of gases produced in combustion (O2, CO, CO2, NOx, particulates and hydrocarbons, among others). Other parameters of interest will also be evaluated, such as temperatures and pressures necessary to efficient combustion.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Secagem de Madeira: Desenvolvimento de sistema queimador de gбs pobre com aplicaзгo em caldeira de centrais termoelйtricas (ANEEL / GERDAU)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Queimadores de gases de baixo poder calorнfico possuem aplicaзхes tanto em centrais termelйtricas quanto em unidades industriais. Em centrais termoelйtricas, ele gera calor para o prй-aquecimento do ar e/ou da бgua de alimentaзгo da caldeira reduzindo o consumo de combustнveis fуsseis. No setor industrial podem prover calor de processo oriundo de biomassa vegetal de uma maneira compacta e limpa. A falta de um queimador especialmente projetado para queimar gбs pobre e que possa ser acoplado nas caldeiras e processos tйrmicos existentes й um gargalo tйcnico que impede o uso de biomassa vegetal em sistemas de combustгo de gases ou aproveitamento de gases de pirуlise de biomassa.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
UFGD Grant: R$ 341.815,11
Gas burners of low heating values (LHV gas) have applications in thermal power projects as well as in industrial plants. In thermal power stations, it generates heat to preheat the air and/or the boiler feed water by reducing the consumption of fossil fuels. In the industrial sector can provide process heat from vegetable biomass of a compact and clean way. The lack of a specially designed burner to burn poor gas and that can be coupled for boilers and existing thermal processes is a technical bottleneck that prevents the use of plant biomass combustion systems gas or the utilization of biomass pyrolysis gases.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Estudo da combustгo de йster-etнlico de Crambe abyssinia em microturbinas a gбs para geraзгo distribuнda (CNPq N° 01/2016 - Universal)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Objetivo: A presente proposta tem como objetivo geral avaliar experimentalmente a utilizaзгo de йster-etнlico de Crambe como alternativa com menor impacto ambiental para produзгo de energia elйtrica utilizando
microturbinas a gбs.
Resumo: O trabalho apresenta a anбlise de uma microturbina operando com йster-etнlico produzido pela
transeterificaзгo de уleo de Crambe abyssinia com etanol etнlico. Abundante na regiгo centro-oeste, o Crambe й uma biomassa que demonstra um potencia para produзгo de combustнvel de origem vegetal sem
ameaзar a seguranзa ambiental. Neste trabalho й desenvolvida uma turbina, a partir de um
turbocompressor automotivo para ensaiar a combustгo desse biocombustнvel. Й realizada ainda uma anбlise
tйcnica e econфmica da utilizaзгo desse combustнvel em microturbinas a gбs como soluзгo de geraзгo
distribuнda.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The work presents the analysis of a microturbine operation using ester produced by the transeterification of Crambe abyssinia oil with ethyl ethanol. Abundant in the Brazilian midwest, Crambe is a biomass that demonstrates a potency for producing vegetable fuel without threatening environmental safety. In this work a turbine is developed, starting from an automotive turbocharger to test the combustion of this biofuel. A technical and economical analysis of the use of this fuel in gas microturbines as a distributed generation solution is also carried out.

Dessa forma, o projeto de pesquisa tende a promover impacto econфmico por agregar um valor relevante ao produto que, antes descartado, dessa forma poderб ser transformado em matйria-prima destinada а outros setores indъstriais, como por exemplo: as indъstrias de comйsticos, tintas, alйm de outras. PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Edital 005/2004 PAPPE INOVA MATO GROSSO FAPEMAT/FINEP PROCESSO Nє 442/2004 Promover o desenvolvimento Cientнfico e Tecnolуgico de empresas com sede e/ou filial no Estado de Mato Grosso, atravйs do incentivo de atividades de pesquisa e desenvolvimento (P&D) de produtos, serviзos e processos inovadores, em fases que precedem а sua comercializaзгo, empreendidos por pesquisadores atuando em cooperaзгo tecnolуgica com empresas, seguindo o constante neste Edital em suas duas FASES. FASE I - Estudo de Viabilidade Tйcnica, Econфmica e Comercial - EVETEC, compreende: realizaзгo dos Planos de trabalho do pesquisador e da identificaзгo da estratйgia de inovaзгo da Empresa. FASE II - Diz respeito ao processo de transformaзгo ou desenvolvimento de um novo produto, serviзo e processos em um bem de uso pelo mercado pъblico ou privado, resultando em um protуtipo do produto, serviзo e/ou processo, bem como o patenteamento e sua comercializaзгo. Coordenaзгo e pesquisa de fontes alternatнvas/renovбveis de energia (Eуlica). O projeto consiste de um sistema de geraзгo de energia eуlica e seu armazenamento em reservatуrios de ar comprimido de maneira que possa ser utilizada tanto na forma de energia elйtrica ou movimentaзгo pneumбtica de equipamentos diversos. Pequenas comunidades isoladas / afastadas de cidades, que sгo carentes de energia p/ suas atividades caseiras e fabris sгo as grandes beneficiadas deste projeto, e ainda pontas de redes para evitar suas perdas. A energia eуlica й uma fonte renovбvel e limpa, ou seja, nгo polui o meio-ambiente. Orзamento Aprovado (FAPEMAT): ~ R$ 28.000,00.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Call FAPEMAT 005/2004 - PAPPE INNOVATES MATO GROSSO FAPEMAT/FINEP no 442/2004 Promoting the scientific and technological development of companies with headquarters and/or branch in the State of Mato Grosso, through the encouragement of research and development (P&D) of products, services and innovative processes, in phases preceding marketing, undertaken by researchers working in technological cooperation with companies following the constant in this public notice in its two phases. PHASE II-relates to the process of transformation or development of a new product, service and processes in a right of use for private or public market, resulting in a prototype of the product, service and/or process, as well as the patenting and marketing. Coordination and research of alternatнvas/renewable energy sources (wind power). The project consists of a wind power generation system and its storage in tanks of compressed air in a manner that can be used in the form of electricity or pneumatic movement of various equipment. Small isolated communities/away from cities, which are lacking in energy p/homemade and manufacturing activities are the major benefits of this project, and even networking tips to avoid your losses. Wind power is a renewable and clean source, i.e. do not pollute the environment. Approved budget (FAPEMAT): ~ R$ 28000.00.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
P,D&I em Tecnologias de Conversao de Combustiveis com foco em Combustiveis Solidos.
A combustгo de resнduos se aproxima daquela do carvгo mineral por serem combustнveis que enfrentam dificuldades e restriзхes ambientais semelhantes. A oportunidade de combinar a combustгo de carvгo mineral com resнduos vem do compartilhamento do complexo conjunto de tratamentos destinados aos seus efluentes gasosos e sуlidos. A viabilidade de sistemas e estratйgias em uma usina de calor e potкncia que queime carvгo e resнduos pode ser alcanзada de diferentes maneiras, e o presente projeto de pesquisa tem como objetivo trabalhar na concepзгo desses arranjos. Como resultado espera-se identificar, classificar e otimizar diferentes arranjos de sistemas usando os dois combustнveis, apуs levantar as rotas tecnolуgicas envolvidas. A atenuaзгo dos impactos ambientais decorrentes dos diferentes arranjos que associem os dois combustнveis serгo quantificados por meio de mйtricas e critйrios de avaliaзгo, com base em critйrios tйcnicos, econфmicos e ambientais. Finalmente, й objetivo da presente proposta a consolidaзгo de uma rede de pesquisa no tema e divulgar o andamento dos trabalhos por meio de workshops, programados no projeto.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Parceria Universitaria para a Formacao Avancada em Engenharia de Energia (CAPES N° 42/2013 - Programa BRAFITEC - BRasil France Ingenieur TEChnologie)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Este projeto apresenta um programa de cooperaзгo acadкmica na бrea de formaзгo de engenheiros ligados а бrea de Energia, composto pelo lado brasileiro pela Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul ? UFRGS, Universidade do Vale do Rio dos Sinos ? UNISINOS, e a Universidade Federal da Grande Dourados ? UFGD e pelo lado francкs Institut National des Sciences Appliquйes de Toulouse ? INSA Toulouse, o Institut National Polytechnique de Toulouse ? INPT e a Йcole des Mines d'Albi-Carmaux.
As 3 universidades brasileiras oferecem cursos especнficos de Engenharia de Energia, alйm de vбrias outras modalidades de engenharia com temбticas ligadas ao assunto. Pelo lado francкs, os parceiros oferecem sequкncias de disciplinas, chamadas de percursos, com o tema energia. A estrutura desses percursos й semelhante nos cursos franceses e encontra similaridade e complementaridade nos cursos de Engenharia de Energia brasileiros.
Todas as condiзхes previstas no Programa BRAFITEC, CAPES/CDEFI (EDITAL nє. 42/2013)
serгo respeitadas.
Justificativa: Os cursos de Engenharia de Energia sгo relativamente novos no Brasil, reunindo temas abordados nas Engenharias Mecвnica, Elйtrica, Quнmica e de Produзгo. Esse arranjo de disciplinas de diferentes engenharias й comum nos cursos franceses, sendo esse o modo de funcionamento dos ъltimos anos dos cursos do INP, INSA e Mines d?Albi.
O programa de intercвmbio proposto pelo BRAFITEC й estratйgico para os 2 paнses. Pelo lado brasileiro, traz a oportunidade de alinhar e consolidar a Engenharia de Energia entre as 3 universidades que tem uma linha pedagуgica prуxima, e tambйm de internacionalizar essa
posta. Pellado francкs, verifica-se que os percurspedagуgicos ligados ao tema Energia tem
procura muito forte no paнs e que os assuntos abordados nгse limitam а realidade da Franзa, mas que buscam exemplos e iteraзхes em outros paнses, incluindo as experiкncias brasileiras.
Essa prбtica francesa de integraзгo de conhecimentos entre alunos de formaзхes distintas
de engenharia, somado ao desenvolvimento de trabalhos em conjunto, desenvolve habilidades que sгo afins а formaзгo desejada dos novos engenheiros de Energia brasileiros, que tambйm pode ser estendida a outros alunos de engenharia que se candidatem ao programa de intercвmbio. Para o aluno francкs, o conhecimento da realidade brasileira em termos de organizaзгo de engenharia, economia e mercado trarб tambйm aportes importantes аs suas carreiras, jб que o intercвmbio internacional estб hoje previsto como complementar a sua formaзгo.

Os objetivos especнfico sгo: - Estabelecer um fуrum contнnuo de debates de prбticas sustentбveis no processo de geraзгo de energia - Fomentar a implementaзгo das polнticas pъblicas prioritбrias ao desenvolvimento regional e nacional - Analisar a composiзгo da matriz energйtica atual e futura do Centro-Oeste; - Integrar as universidades, centros de pesquisa, уrgгos e empresas do setor energйtico, alйm do pъblico em geral da regiгo para debater o futuro energйtico da regiгo Centro-Oeste; - Disseminar conceitos fundamentais relativos a energias renovбveis e sustentabilidade ambiental - Avaliar a confiabilidade de fornecimento e possibilidade de substituiзгo parcial ou integral do insumo energйtico em consumo. - Promover a sinergia e integraзгo dos conhecimentos associados ao ensino de graduaзгo e pesquisa desenvolvida em cursos de pуs-graduaзгo da IES.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Modelos sazonais para radiaзгo solar incidente na бrea rural de Dourados-MS
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Seasonal models for net solar radiation in the countryside area at Dourados-MS

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract. A continuous mathematical model can assist in predicting the characteristics of solar radiation (W/mІ) in a particular region, by reducing the need for experimental measurements. This paper aims to propose a representative, and predictive modeling, to the net solar radiation in Dourados-MS, assessing its intensity, behavior and seasonal changes. Raw data for the period 2008-2011 were obtained by meteorological wheater station located at UFGD campus. The methodology was developed as part of a research project for prospection of solar potential in Dourados and nearby cities, and uses polynomial functions as mathematical model to represent and polynomial trimentral (seasonal) of the net solar radiation. The results represent the profile of a typical day for the meteorological variable modeled in various periods of time. The main conclusions are: i) model features standard deviation reduced in the period of highest values for Rn (12h ? 15h) and also features for Gauss statistical distribution; ii) the mathematical modelling by means of continuous functions is able to represent the intensity and behavior characteristics of net solar radiation (Rn), for monthly and quarterly periods (seasonal), besides being able of good forecast for future behavior (2011); iii) the methodology proposed, together with the statistical analysis of Rn, is efficient in the parameterization of local features for net solar radiation; iv) Rn seasonal features indicate that the maximum values are fairly stable in the months of the 1st and 4th quarter, but are decreasing in the 2nd and 3rd quarter and culminate in minimum values in July.
Key words: mathematical modeling, statistical distributions, weather variables, energy in agriculture.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Avaliaзгo preliminar do aproveitamento de energia eуlica no municнpio de Vilhena-RO
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Avaliaзгo preliminar do aproveitamento de energia eуlica no municнpio de Vilhena-RO

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract: Brazilґs Central-West and North are geographical regions with few researches registered in the technical-scientific literature of the potential for wind energy harnessing. To know wind regime and the conditions prevailing in each location are important for better estimations of the local wind energy potential, among other applications dependent on these characteristics. The aim of this work is to determine the prevailing wind speed direction and its intensity (mean values and occurrence frequencies), as well as their seasonal behavior in the city of Vilhena-RO. Furthermore, perform preliminary assessment of the local wind energy potential. Methodology considers data recorded every hour, weather station located at Vilhena-RO municipal airport (latitude 12° 42'S, longitude 60° 05 'W and altitude 612m), with anemometer installed 9m above ground level, and historical series in the period 01/2003 to 01/2004. Occurrence frequencies for direction are set at 30° intervals and 1,0 m/s intervals for wind speed. The results, considering the historical series analyzed and local geographical features, it can highlight the following: i) prevailing directions of wind speed are toward East (E) and North (N); ii) Maximum recorded wind speed is 10 m/s (or 36-km/h); iii) Average annual wind speed ~3.5 m/s; iv) Wind energy potential is estimated for ~ 47.44 W/mІ.
Keyword: Renewable energy, Meteorological weather stations, Statistics, Mathematical models, Isolated communities.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: 097-Disponibilidade de biogбs e esterco suнno em municнpios no territуrio da Grande Dourados para uso em sistemas de produзгo agroecolуgicos
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Biogas and pig manure availability in cities within 'Grande Dourados' territory for use in ecological farming systems

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract: This paper presents the results for the availability of biogas and pig manure in cities at the Grande Dourados territory. Swine farming is an activity that requires working with animals in confinement and, therefore, the waste produced need a proper destination from the environmental and sustainability points of view, as well the fact of being a raw material of great interest in ecological farming systems. A methodology adapted from the literature is considered for determining the amount of biogas (mі year-1) and pig maner (tonnes / year) which can be obtained using biodigesters. We conclude that the use of solid residues as organic fertilizer is a product with important added value to assist in the costs of the activity. Furthermore, one should consider that the environmental aspect is sheltered in the rural property to properly treat the solids and liquids residues, allowing other agroecological activities may also benefit from the use of waste as organic fertilizer for vegetables and fruits.
Keywords: organic fertilezer, pig farming, environment, residual biomass.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: 054-Potencial agroecolуgico para uso do bagaзo da cana-de-aзъcar na adubaзгo orgвnica no estado de Mato Grosso do Sul
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Agroecological potential for use of sugarcane bagasse in the organic fertilization at the Mato Grosso do Sul state

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract: This work presents some characteristics of sugarcane bagasse that are of interest to organic manure. The goal is to identify the agro-ecological potential for use of that residual biomass, considering the increasing availability of these agro-industrial residues in the state of Mato Grosso do Sul as a function of sugar industry currently installed. The methodology for determining the characteristics of sugarcane bagasse follows the procedure specified in ABNT technical standards for determination of pH and moisture. We conclude that, although the main use in industrial environments for the sugarcane bagasse is as fuel for boilers, with the consequent power cogeneration, the large amount of residual biomass from agroindustries and the characteristics of these when stored for long period enables the use equally interesting as organic fertilizer.
Keywords: residual biomass, energy, water, food, environment.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: 032-Benefнcios da fertirrigaзгo com vinhaзa na melhoria do solo e а produtividade da cana-de-aзъcar
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Benefits from vinasse fertigation on soil improvements and sugarcane productivity

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract: The aim of this paper is to assess the benefits to soil properties and sugarcane productivity increases, as well as highlighting the potential for diversified organic crops, as function of vinasse fertigation. Experiments were performed on the Anhanguera - Uniderp university, at campus III, between october/2009 (planting) and april/2010 (cutting). Fertigation was considered for five different vinasse doses (0, 100, 200, 400 e 800 mі.ha-1) and 8-10 L.m-2 daily irrigation. Three soil layers were analyzed (0-10, 10-20 and 20-40 cm) on the content of organic matter, K, Ca and pH, as well as productivity. We conclude that the use of vinasse for organic fertilization and irrigation (fertigation) represents a promising application from the agroecological point of view (disposal of polluting residues), technical and economic (productivity growth). The benefits to the soil are not restricted sugarcane cultivation, once equally interesting results can be obtained in others agroecosystems, focusing on the ecological farming.
Keywords: organic fertilizer, irrigation, environment, agroecosystems, vinasse.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Direзгo predominante, velocidade do vento e suas frequкncias de ocorrкncia em Dourados-MS
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Prevailing direction, wind speed and its occurence frequency in Dourados-MS

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resultados de Projeto de Pesquisa com fomento externo: Avaliaзгo do potencial regional para aproveitamento de energia solar e eуlica na regiгo da grande Dourados (FUNDECT N° 09/2008 - Universal)
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
ABSTRACT: The use of wind energy has been the subject of intense research development and activities. It is a potential energy source still unexplored in small and medium-sized facilities, example of wind characteristics of Brazilґs Central-West region. To know the wind regime and the prevailing conditions in each location is important for a better estimate of the regional wind power potential. The objective of this work was to determine the predominant direction and intensity of wind speed (medium-sized and major frequencies of occurrence), as well as its seasonal behavior in the municipality of Dourados-MS. The methodology considers the data recorded every hour by a semi-automatic weather station located on UFGD campus (latitude 22° 11' S, longitude 54° 55' e altitude of 454 m), with an anemometer installed at 2 m above ground level, and historical series in the period 2005-2009. Analysis of daily and monthly average were addressed, as well as the frequencies of occurrence (absolute and relative),direction (15° intervals) and speed (0.5 m.s-1 intervals) obtained. The following conclusions are highlighted: a) the predominant wind direction is North-East (NE); (b) in January, the wind average speed is 1.4 ± 0.2 m.s-1, and the wind annual average daily speed is 2.0 ± 0.5 m.s-1; c) the daily average maintains the original characteristics of the phenomenon (which does not occur to monthly averages), which is represented by the typical statistical behavior of the Weibull and Rayleigh distributions found in the literature.

KEYWORDS: Wind energy; Wind power potential; Renewable energies; Energy in agriculture; Wind turbines.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: QUANTIFICAЗГO DO BIOGБS DA SUINOCULTURA E DA ENERGIA TЙRMICA OBTIDA VIA COMBUSTГO NA REGIГO CENTRO-OESTE DO BRASIL
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Biogas quantification from pig farming and thermal energy obtained by its combustion in Brazilґs Central Western region

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
ABSTRACT: This article aims to determine, in Brazilґs Central Western region and its states, the annual amount of biogas that can be obtained from pig farming, and its potential for conversion into thermal energy (heat). The resulting thermal energy has several applications in rural areas and agro-industrial activities, in which there is intensive use of energy in agriculture and animal breeding. The use biogas in pig farming is motivated primarily by the need for proper environmental disposal for manure and fuel availability that can be used to obtain thermal and/or electrical energy, and other current issues related to global warming. In Brazil and in its Central Western Region, there is a great availability of residual biomass from plant and animal origin. When it comes to animal manure, pig farming in Mato Grosso do Sul, Mato Grosso, Goiбs and at Federal District is an activity that may result in additional financial income regarding carbon credits and biogas itself, or its use as renewable energy source. The final step of transforming biomass into biofuel occurs when there is a conversion of its energy content in the fuel (J/kg)via combustion process, into thermal energy (J). The methodology is adapted from National Reference Center on Biomass ? CENBIO, and considers the raw data base provided by the IBGE. The data processing and consolidation considers a historical series of eight years (2002-2008). Biodigesters were considered to estimate the annual volume of biogas produced. Finally, the combustion process in industrial burners was assumed to occur at optimal conversion efficiency of the chemical energy (biogas) into thermal energy (heat). The results showed that significant amounts of thermal energy can be obtained, reaching annually 15,000 TEP (~~640,000 GJ) in Mato Grosso do Sul, almost the double of these values in Goiбs and around 20% higher in Mato Grosso.

KEYWORDS:Residual biomass; Biofuels; Renewable energy sources.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Bioenergia da biomassa residual: Potencial energйtico da combustгo da casca de arroz em Dourados-MS e regiгo
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Bioenergia da biomassa residual: Potencial energйtico da combustгo da casca de arroz em Dourados-MS e regiгo

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract: Biomass is raw material for bioenergy, which transformations until energy final uses may be carried as biofuels (biodiesel and alcohol/ethanol), biogas (agricultural or urban residues), vegetal coal or even as vegetable waste blocks (brickets) to be burned and used as thermal energy in steam thermodynamic cycles. The search for alternative energy sources to fossil fuels, in view of the interest in its renewable characteristics, such as the biomass, has grown mainly due to economic and environmental factors. This article point out data on the availability of raw biomass (rough rice) in twelve districts of the Mato Grosso do Sul state, located in the region named ?Grande Dourados?, where is installed the UFGD. The issue lies in the context of access and end use of energy (thermal, electrical and others) in more remote regions of the country where the distribution of electricity is situated outside the major networks, is weak or nonexistent, and fossil fuels have a high transportation costs. Thus, these regions require isolated sources of local energy supply. Results are discussed and considerations made about the potential of energy that can be obtained in the region, using biomass as renewable sources of energy through the combustion process of the raw material from rough rice.
Keyword: solid biofuels, renewable energy, thermal systems, waste to energy.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Caracterнsticas e potencial energйtico do bagaзo da cana-de-aзъcar armazenado sem cobertura por um perнodo prolongado
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Characteristics and energy potential of sugarcane stored in the open for an extended period

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: RAMA - Revista em Agronegуcio e Meio Ambiente

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Carta de aceite com indicaзгo de publicaзгo:
v. 13, n. 1, jan./mar. de 2020 
na Revista em Agronegуcio e Meio Ambiente - RAMA - ISSN 2176-9168 (On-line)
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
ABSTRACT: Biomass is the third largest source of energy for conversion into electricity in the country, of which sugarcane bagasse is the most relevant energy input. Bagasse is residual biomass from industrial milling process, whose storage is necessary due to the production seasonality. The experiments were carried out for material samples stored in different positions (differentiated degradation), retrieved from an agroindustrial unit with 70000 tons purchased for use in its steam boiler. The objective is to evaluate the physical and chemical characteristics (immediate analysis, including moisture) and energy (calorific value) of sugarcane bagasse when subjected to open storage for three years; with this study the influence of climate and storage conditions on changes of this residual biomass energy potential. Main results are: a) Density increases four times and THumidity,WB reaches 85% when the bagasse is under open storage; b) Reduced TAsh (1%) allows lower damage and maintenance when used in steam boilers; c) No significant degradation for use as solid fuel, considering TVM,DB and TFC,DB, respectively responsible for ignition and stability of combustion, and significant contribution in HHV; d) Average values for heating value (HHV) will be consumed in 15% or more on bagasse drying process; e) The thermal energy available (~ 27000 TEP) has significant potential for power cogeneration and increase the added-value of agroindustrialproduction. 

Keywords: Sugarcane agribusiness sector; Residual biomass; Industrial combustion; Power cogeneration.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: ENSAIO DE TORQUE E CONSUMO DE COMBUSTНVEL DE UMA MOTOSSERRA UTILIZANDO TRКS MISTURAS DE BIOCOMBUSTНVEL
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: ENSAIO DE TORQUE E CONSUMO DE COMBUSTНVEL DE UMA MOTOSSERRA UTILIZANDO TRКS MISTURAS DE BIOCOMBUSTНVEL

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Aceito para publicaзгo: v.34, n.2, 2019.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: Small-scale internal combustion engines are often used to support activities in agricultural properties. The manufacturers of these types of equipment, such as 2T engines in chainsaws and the like, recommend the use of lubricating oil alongside the fuel consumption. However, the gasoline commercialized in Brazil contains a volumetric fraction of 27.5% of ethanol fuel. The performance of combustion engines for fuel consumption and torque can be modified according to the ethanol content in the fuel mixture. Thus, the objective of this work is to evaluate in the test bench, the torque and fuel consumption of a chainsaw with a two-stroke engine using different requested loads and proportions of ethanol in gasoline. The methodology applied to perform the tests were based on the technical norms ABNT, NBR 7024:2010-volumetric method of consumption and NBR 13992:2008-determination of anhydrous ethanol fuel (AEAC). A dedicated dynamometric workbench was built for the chainsaw equipment to simulate its operational conditions. Each test was repeated three times and analyzed the two most coherent ones; with four distinct rotations, three different loads and three combustible samples named as (A) 73% G/27% E, (B) 60% G/40% E, and (C) 50% G/50% E. The results obtained, considering the characteristic curves of fuel consumption and torque, point to the following conclusions: i) in limited rotations up to 8200 RPM, the fuel (A) showed the lowest fuel consumption; ii) in rotations above 8500 RPM, the fuel (B) showed higher torque value and lower fuel consumption; (iii) fuel (C) is inadequate for any of the conditions tested; iv) fuel consumption characteristic curve is almost twice when compared to the maximum and minimum load condition; v) torque characteristic curve is enlarged by about 4 to 5 times when comparing maximum and minimum load conditions; vi) There is a significant increase in fuel consumption above 10000 RPM, in the intermediate load conditions with fuels A a

Potencial energйtico do biogбs e distribuiзгo geogrбfica no MS para destinaзгo de resнduos na suinocultura
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Biogas energy potential and geographical distribution in MS for swine breeding waste disposal

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: DOI: 10.4025/revtecnol.v29i1.47857
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract: Central-West region states concentrates the major Brazilian swine production scales, which facilitates the logistics of production and distribution of products (meat) and value-added co-products (biogas and bio-fertilizers). That activity produces daily large amounts of residual animal biomass, with possibility to meet local energy demand and/or surplus selling, as well as appropriate destination of effluents generated. Methodology for determination of biogas volume (mі.year-1) and electricity (kWh.year-1), based on real swine heard (2008-2016) in micro and meso-regions of Mato Grosso do Sul state. Main findings include quantification of the energy potential in ~4% of electricity demand in the State, as well as the importance of co-products (biogas and bio-fertilizers) with added value relevant to the costing of the activity of pig farming and sustainability environmental.
Keywords: renewable energy, residual biomass, biodigestors, environmental control.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: CARACTERНSTICAS ENERGЙTICAS DA TORTA DE CRAMBE INDUSTRIAL APУS EXTRAЗГO DE УLEO PARA BIODIESEL
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Crambe press cake energy characteristics after industrial oils extraction for biodiesel

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Aceito em Marзo/2020
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract: Biodiesel production in Brazil uses soybeans as the main raw material, whose oil
content is ~24%, while for crambe it reaches ~40%. The crambe press cake (~60% of the
original weight) is residual biomass in the oil extraction process, which remains without
adequate commercial destination seen inadequacy as food when in raw conditions. The
objective is to investigate the energy characteristics of crambe press cake by identifying the
potential valuation of this by-product for conversion into thermal energy. Crambe samples
after industrial processing in a biodiesel plant were analyzed to determine the proximate and
elemental composition, as well as bulk density and heating values (HHV and LHV). Main
conclusions are: a) Low moisture content and reduced drying time; b) attractive
complementary characteristics for proximate and ultimate analysis (TCF,bs, TMV,bs,TC, TH and
TO), except for TCZ,bs ~6% which is higher than other typical biomasses; c) PCS ~22 MJ.kg-1
is ~20% higher than PCS for sugarcane bagasse; d) The marketing of this co-product is may
be made possible after densification in the form of pellets or briquettes, although the bulk
density is adequate under the conditions received (ρbulk~846 kg.m-3); e) The various favorable
characteristics listed for use as solid fuel corroborate for an appreciation of this industrial waste via combustion and conversion into thermal and/or electric energy, that is, potential to
add economic value in the biodiesel production chain.
Keywords: renewable energy, biomass, industrial residues, waste-to-energy.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Cerrado native wood charcoal in stell and energy applicatios

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: RAMA - Revista em Agronegуcio e Meio Ambiente

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Fabricaзгo de coque, de produtos derivados do petrуleo e de biocombustнveis

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
ABSTRACT: International Brazilian steel quality is due to charcoal use in the metallurgical process, Mato Grosso do Sul state, the largest national producer in 2011 (~356,000 tonnes). This work aims energy quality assessment of this solid biofuel originated from native species woods (vegetable suppression, without deforestation) and geographical availability, to attend regional demand from steel, ceramic and energy industries. The methodology considered IBGE database (2007-2016), quality aspects determination (PCS, proximate and ultimate analyzes) and parameters comparison to charcoal from other native species, planted ones and residual biomass. Results indicate: a) MS state is among four major annual producers, and second largest national one (2007-2016); b) Most productive micro-regions are ?Aquidauana? (~21%) and "Trкs Lagoas" (~23%); c) Geographical distribution of the current production is balanced in the meso-regions "Centro Norte" (~34%), "Leste" (~30%) and "Pantanais" (~25%); d) Regional production is of medium quality, presenting TCZ~0.9%, TUM,BU~5%, TMV~33%, TCF~66%; d) HHV~20.7 MJ.kg-1 (↓TCF), TH~5.0%, TO~3.9% and TC~86.3%, with C/H~17.3; e) Potential to improve quality (↑TCF, ↓TMV and ↑HHV) and productivity (mass yield, %).
Keywords: Renewable energy; Forest biomass; firewood; Pyrolysis; Agribusiness.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Programa em linguagem Fortran cuja descriзгo estб em inglкs nas linhas abaixo.

The Apuld program is used to determinate the loads at APU CG and APU mounts. The calculation procedure is made considering the inertial loads, the gyroscopic loads, the thrust and torque to find the resultant loads at reference points.

The APU mass must be in accordance to the BOW available in the FUSLD and WINGD mass files (from weight and balance group) for the airplane and phase calculation.

The APU speeds and polar moments of inertia must be in accordance to data considered for the airplane and phase calculation.

APULD 2.2 considered a correction to calculate loads at the APU CG, while the previous versions considered the loads at the APU reference point (even that it was indicating as APU CG). When these points are not equal that presented an incorrection.

APULD 2.3 presents eth following improvements to:

1) Option to obtain loads envelopes without generating UNITS 08 and 10, what would take a long time to process;
2) Option to calculate (or not) loads at the APU mounts. That occurs when the transfer matrix (from APU CG to the APU mounts) are not available, as in the ERJ 170 / 190 family;
3) It is possible to run up to 10 Cases Files (Airplane response parameters - 21 lines), not requiring the user to concatenate then by hand work;
4) UNIT 13 provides loads in standard format for fatigue analysis (and 1-g dynamic), if necessary;
5) Envelope cases are checked for duplication of names ( 8 digits identification );

DETALHAMENTO-DO-SOFTWARE.FINALIDADE: Obter Perfil de Coeficientes Aerodinвmicos em Fuselagens de Aeronaves

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Programa em linguagem Fortran cuja descriзгo estб em inglкs nas linhas abaixo.

CPFUS program is used to determinate aerodynamic distributions (forces and pressures coefficients) along the fuselage lenght, and when required for fuselage loads calculations.

CPFUS reads the initial distributions profiles from CFD analysis of Lz/Q (for ALFA = 0 and ALFA = 10) and Ly/Q (for BETA = 0 and BETA = 10) to mach the total aerodynamic load for an specified condition / tunnel case (FX, FZ and My or FY and MZ).

That process requires as references, profiles for unitary forces (Force = 1) and moments (Moment = 1) to generate the aerodynamic distribution along the fuselage panels (in its center), referred to unitary areas.

CPFUS 2.3 presents the following improvements:

1) Option to obtain the body coefficients from values provided by UNIT 31 (wing-body) and 32 (wings) or from UNIT 35 (as in CPFUS 2.2). These coefficients are presented in tables and PLOTG formats in UNITS 43 and 44;

2) UNIT 34 must contain Lz/Q and Ly/Q distributions for all mach numbers, whicj are going to be interpolated when necessary;

3) UNIT 35 must contain unitary profiles for FX/FZ, FY and MY/MZ;

4) Option to process the analysis of cases with ALFA(CFx and CFz) or BETA(CFy);

5) Automatic plotting (excel) for PLOTG format files;

Programa em linguagem Fortran cuja descriзгo estб em inglкs nas linhas abaixo.

The Engpl program is used to determinate the loads at engine CG, engine mounts and pylon CG. The calculation procedure is made considering the inertial loads, the gyroscopic loads, the aerodynamic loads and the thrust to find the resultant loads at reference points.

All masses (engine, pylon and nacelle) must be in accordance to the BOW available in the FUSLD and WINGD mass files (from weight and balance group) for the airplane and phase calculation.

The engine speed and polar moments of inertia must be in accordance to data considered for the airplane and phase calculation. FSIML engine routine is also a reference for data calculation.

Loads are also available in the local (powerplant) reference system at engine and pylon reference points.

For fatigue analysis, loads in the engine and pylon reference points are also provided.

The program uses the WING ROOT LOADS and FUSELAGE RUNNING LOADS to calculate the unbalanced forces and moments (WING-BODY).These values are positioned in the 21є line of the Airplane Response Parameters file generated by FSIML program (output 21 lines cases).

Fuselage loads "balanced" are obtained using these cases.

Airplane Parameters for Asymmetrical Mass AND / OR Response, it is necessary to obtain the cases corresponding to the left and right wings, calculating the WING ROOT LOADS and then evaluate the unbalance of the airplane.That is valid If only left wing loads are be provided from WINGD program versions <= 7.0

For WINGD program versions > 7.0, it is possible to obtain Left and Right WING ROOT LOADS with only one set of cases.The cases must be in the same order at UNIT 03 and 07 (if necessary) respectively for left and right wing, otherwise the program will present wrong results. SELCAS program can be used to order the cases.

EGRAF is an on-line program that provides comparison of Plotg graphics or their envelope.
When running for envelopes calculation, the user can choose for interpolate curves and verify nearest points. When running for envelopes comparison, the user can choose for superposition os curves or percentual comparison between two curves.
It also presents tables for the maximum and minimum values (envelopes) or table with percentual differences (comparison) between two envelopes.
Next are presented examples for Comparisons or and Envelopes options.

For EGRAF 5.3.0 Version, the Origin macro (Origin Directory) must be replaced by the ones located at the EGRAF Directory (Macros Origin, labels and no-labels files), otherwise the Origin plotting process will not work.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Equimass is a program to calculate weight and CG from the fuselage and wing mass distributions.

The program also gives as outputs the masses integrations along the wing and fuselage, allowing to plot automatically. It can be compared to others airplane models of interest using E-graf program.

Notice that landing gears at up position are considered for CG calculation and the envelope of weight and CG usually provided considers the landing gears at down position. To match the values provided by WEIGHT and BALANCE, it is necessary to choose landing gear positions set DOWN For wing and fuselage calculation, each case will indicate if the landing gears positions are UP or DOWN.

The mass configurations must be in the same order at UNIT 02 and 03 respectively for wing and fuselage mass distribution, otherwise the program will not be executed and present error messages.

Outputs for wing and fuselage masses integration in PLOTG formats allow a maximum of 999 points for each curve, when plotting.

ETABLE is an on-line program that provides comparison of Tables values and / or their envelopes.

For envelope option, the program will generate UNIT 30 that constains maximum / minimum loads and cases (envelopes) between all input files (maximum of 10, UNITS 20 up to 29).

For comparison option, the program will generate UNIT 30 that constains maximum / minimum loads and cases (envelopes) between two input files (2 files, UNITS 20 and 21). It also generate UNIT 40 that presents tables with percentual differences (comparison) between two tables envelopes.

Next are presented examples for Comparisons and Envelopes options.

Exbld program generates aerodynamic and inertial loads at attachment fittings and/or CG of any external body of the aircraft components. The aerodynamic coefficients CD, CY, CL, CR, CM and CN are taken directly from the aerodynamic data bank. The input cases may be in several files, allowing the program to be run in batch mode. In this new version the evaluation of axial loads on struts is presented. Only the input files (two) may be edited during the execution of the program. The output file is only created if you enter the path and name of it , otherwise it is ignored. The other improvement provided by this version of the program is that at the end the envelope cases are generated.

This program is used to determinate the load factors in several points of the aircraft and to select the maximum and minimum values of this load factors in each of this point.

FATCA 6.4 presentes the following improvements:

1) Option to obtain load factors envelope without generating UNITS 08, 09, 13, 15 and 16, what would take a long time to process;
2) It is possible to run up to 10 Cases Files (Airplane response parameters - 21 lines), not requiring the user to concatenate then by hand work;
3) UNIT 13 provides load factors in standard format for fatigue / dynamic analysis, if necessary;
4) Envelope cases are checked for duplication of names (8 digits identification);
5) Automatic plotting (excel) for envelopes files;

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Programa em linguagem Fortran cuja descriзгo estб em inglкs nas linhas abaixo.

The program FUSFLOORLOADS reads as INPUT files, UNIT 20 that contains the volumes definitions (it is also an INPUT from FUSLD program) and UNITS 21 / 22 in the nastran cards formats (it is also OUTPUTS from FUSLD program).
 
UNIT 20 contains the volumes definition (it is also an INPUT from FUSLD program), where the number of volumes for each cases is obtained. 
 
UNIT 21 contains the total loads (Inertia + Aerodynamics + Concentrated) in the nastran cards formats (it is also OUTPUTS from FUSLD program).
 
UNIT 22 contains floor loads (only due to Floor Structures + Pax / Ballast Pax + Optionals) in the nastran cards formats (it is also OUTPUTS from FUSLD program). So, UNIT 22 excludes Inertia Loads due to HT / VT / NLG Structure + Baggage / Ballast Bag + Stub Fuel.
 
The FUSFLOORLOADS program calculates the differences between UNITS 21 and 22, that represents the (Total - Floor) Loads at UNIT 30, which contains in its first half the (Total - Floor) Loads and in its second half, Floor Loads (from UNIT 22).
 
Structural analysis of the floor and the complete airplane can be performed based on the UNIT 30 OUTPUT file.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-3: Fabricaзгo e Montagem de Embarcaзхes, Veнculos Ferroviбrios e Aeronaves

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Programa em linguagem Fortran cuja descriзгo estб em inglкs nas linhas abaixo.

FSIML314 is a computer program that gives the airplane six degrees of freedom rigid body response to prescribed forcing functions. The forcing functions are control surface displacement profiles (elevator, rudder and aileron displacement vs. time) or a gust profile so that FAR Part 23 and JAR 23 static flight conditions requirements are complied with.

The solution of the motion equations is accomplished by numerical integration, so that nonlinear effects of aerodynamic characteristics of the airplane are taken into account. Numerical integration provides only an approximate solution, the accuracy of the solution depending on the method of integration and the time step adopted.

The basis of the program consists in evaluation of external forces at each time step, calculation of the associated rigid body accelerations using the equations of motions and integration of these accelerations to obtain the velocities and displacements. The external forces that cause the airplane to depart from an initial steady flight condition are of aerodynamic or thrust nature. In the aerodynamic case, it is caused by control surface displacements or gusts. The Data Flow Diagram for the FSIML314 module is the same used for the FSIML145.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Programa em linguagem Fortran cuja descriзгo estб em inglкs nas linhas abaixo.

Static loads on fuselage have been determined associating the aerodynamic, inertial and concentrated loads produced by the flight and ground conditions, thus defining the total loads, internal loads (shear force, bending and torsion moments) and pressure distributions on component.
For calculation purposes the fuselage is represented as a beam, which lies along the fuselage reference line. The beam is supposed embed at a conventional wing-fuselage joint, and free at fore and aft ends. Internal running loads are computed at several stations along this reference line.
The integration of shear loads and moments is done from the ends up to the embedment. Since concentrated loads may be applied at the calculations stations, running loads are evaluated immediately before and after each station. Internal loads are obtained by adding and integrating inertial loads, fuselage aerodynamic loads and concentrated loads

Units 30 and 32 provide envelope cases from the current running (pos-processing through SELCS program unnecessary).
Units 20 and 21 provide loads at specified grid points for structural analysis (nastran).
Units 25 (aerodynamic loads) and 26 (running loads) for individual cases indicated at UNIT 11.
FUSLD version 18.5 can obtain aerodynamic loads adjusting to each case the fuselage aerodynamic load, eliminating the balancing process (wing-fuselage adjustment). Unbalanced values (if they exist) are not due to aerodynamics on the fuselage, then no aerodynamic correction in the last line in the cases files (aerodynamic response / 21 lines file) will be ignored . Units 34, 35 and 45 are required in this case (so, it is always necessary to run WINGD 71 first or WBT 1.2 programs)

This program is used to interpolate (or linearly extrapolate, when necessary) the load factors envelopes (dynamic conditions of landing, taxiing, tuned and continuous gust) at several points of the aircraft components (wing, winglet, fuselage, HT, VT, pylon and nacelle).
The resulting envelope must be presented in the same points (equal X, Y and Z coordinates) as the ones for the static envelopes, allowing both envelopes to be combined in a final / global envelope of conditions for maximum and minimum loads / load factors analysis

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Programa em linguagem Fortran cuja descriзгo estб em inglкs nas linhas abaixo.

Rajas program uses Vertical Gust Airplane Response (symmetrical) as input data to obtain Unsymmetrical Gust Airplane Response in accordance to requirements stablished in: FAR 25.349 Rolling Conditions, (b) Unsymmetrical Gusts.

"The airplane is assumed to be subjected to unsymmetrical vertical gusts in level flight. The resulting limit loads must be determined from either the wing maximum airload derived directely from FAR 25.341 (a) Discrete Gust Design Criteria, or the wing maximum airload derived inderectly fro the vertical load factor calculated from FAR 25.341(a). It must be assumed that 100 % of the wing airload acts on one side of the airplane and 80 % of the wing airload acts on other side."

For each Vertical Gust case it is outputed 2 Unsymmetrical Gust cases.
The outputs can be generated with different percentages of FXWB and FZWB taken from the original Vertical Gust case. They are:
- Wing Loads Left only (for WINGD LOADS PROGRAM versions < = 7.0) 1 case with 100% (Pp > 0, Roll to Right) and the other with 80% (Pp < 0, Roll to Left)

- Wing Loads Left and Right (for WINGD LOADS PROGRAM versions > 7.0) 1 case with 90% (Pp > 0, Roll to Right) and the other with 90% (Pp < 0, Roll to Left)

When using EMB-145 family data, the lines CONFANV, CONDVOO, DEFCOML, DEFCOMT, FMWB (truncated values - integer*8), FMHT e FMVT will present extra information ( 0.0 ), at the end.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Programa em linguagem Fortran cuja descriзгo estб em inglкs nas linhas abaixo.

WINGD is a computer program that gives the wing internal running loads in terms of shear force, bending and torsion moment at several wing stations, having as basis the wing-fuselage aerodynamic load, airplane CG accelerations and angular velocities, which are calculated by means of simulation of the flight and ground conditions specified by RBHA 25, FAR Part 25 and JAR 25.

For calculation purposes, the integration of shear loads and moments is done from the wing tip up to the root section combining the aerodynamic, inertial and concentrated loads: 

- Aerodynamic loads distribution

Wing aerodynamic loads distribution are calculated taking the wing-fuselage force from simulation and distributing it over the appropriate vortex lattice model of the wing;

- Inertia loads

Wing inertia loads result from the airplane CG accelerations and angular velocities acting over wing mass due to wing structure and systems, main landing gear, wing tanks and fuel;

- Concentrated loads

Concentrated loads are the main landing gear attachments loads during landing and ground maneuvers. They introduce discontinuities at running loads distribution, thus the running loads at any wing station are calculated just before the section and just after it. The program was modified to accept now up to 90000 concentrated loads.



 Characteristics

- Aerodynamic loads are considered as local loads;

- Aerodynamic drag correction is done using drag coefficients;

- Surface loads are defined by panels;

- Loads resultants in the wing root is in a fuselage reference point;

- Loads redistribution along the structural model is done using a matrix (spline of surface method);

- Graphics are plotted in plotg and plots formats;

- An aerodynamic model for redistribution is generated;

- Dynamic loads are calculated by a modal dynamic response and by modal characteristics.

- From the

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Programa em linguagem Fortran cuja descriзгo estб em inglкs nas linhas abaixo:

The PILONES program is used to calculate the loads acting on EMB-314 external pylons. The aircraft has 4 under wing pylons and 1 ventral pylon. The pylon loads are taken as the result of combination of inertia loads, aerodynamic loads and "pyrotechnic" loads. Aircraft parameters (alpha, beta, Nx, Ny, Nz, p, q, r, pp, qp, rp) are obtained from the flight and ground conditions. The results are presented as forces (Fx, Fy, Fz), moments (Mx, My, Mz) and a total resultant force and moment (Ft, Mt), acting on a representative point specified in the general data input.

SS314 (Spectrum Summation) is a FORTRAN program that performs summation of fatigue loads spectrum for airplane components (fuselage, wing, powerplant, load factors, etc). The loads in each coordinate (X, Y and Z) and flight /ground conditions are added one to the others resulting in the airplane component life usage for structural analysis.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
O autor desenvolveu uma mйtodologia simplificada para obter envelope (valores mбximos e mнnimos) de tensхes ou esforзos estruturais para dimensionamento da Fuselagem de aeronaves.
Considerou-se que os esforзos na estrutura de aeronave similares durante o vфo й funзгo principalmente da integraзгo da distribuiзгo de massas discretizadas ao longo da fuselagem e portanto pode-se utilizar com uma precisгo de 95%
(5 % de erro) o conjunto de condiзхes que foram relevantes para uma aeronave similar, mas para todas as configuraзхes/distribuiзхes de massa especнficas da aeronave para a qual se deseja obter as novas cargas.
Isto permitiu que a quantidade de condiзхes a serem analisadas fosse reduzida de um nъmero em torno de 300.000 para 1000, o que representa um ganho substancial no tempo dispendido para processamento de informaзхes e posterior anбlise
de consistкncia, considerando aceitбvel um erro
de 5% entre as duas metodologias.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O objetivo geral do II Workshop: Os Caminhos da Energia no Centro-Oeste й debater, analisar e avaliar possнveis cenбrios energйticos para a regiгo Centro-Oeste levando em conta a crescente demanda de energia e a integraзгo com paнses vizinhos. Os objetivos especнfico sгo: - Estabelecer um fуrum contнnuo de debates de prбticas sustentбveis no processo de geraзгo de energia - Fomentar a implementaзгo das polнticas pъblicas prioritбrias ao desenvolvimento regional e nacional - Analisar a composiзгo da matriz energйtica atual e futura do Centro-Oeste; - Integrar as universidades, centros de pesquisa, уrgгos e empresas do setor energйtico, alйm do pъblico em geral da regiгo para debater o futuro energйtico da regiгo Centro-Oeste; - Disseminar conceitos fundamentais relativos a energias renovбveis e sustentabilidade ambiental - Avaliar a confiabilidade de fornecimento e possibilidade de substituiзгo parcial ou integral do insumo energйtico em consumo. - Promover a sinergia e integraзгo dos conhecimentos associados ao ensino de graduaзгo e pesquisa desenvolvida em cursos de pуs-graduaзгo da IES.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The overall objective of the II Workshop: energy paths in Brazilґs Central-West region is to brainstorm, analyze and evaluate possible energy scenarios for the Midwest region taking into account the growing demand for energy and integration with neighbouring countries. The specific objectives are:-Establish a continuous forum for discussions of sustainable practices in the process of energy generation-to foster the implementation of public policies for regional development and national priority-to analyze the composition of the current and future energy matrix in the Midwest; -Integrate universities, research centers, agencies and companies in the energy sector, in addition to the general public in the region to discuss the energy future of the Midwest; -Disseminate fundamental concepts relating to renewable energy and environmental sustainability-assessing the reliability of supply and possibility of partial or full replacement of input energy consumption. -Promoting synergy and integration of knowledge associated with the undergraduate education and research in graduate courses in higher education institutions.
